abstract: Police are suspected of carrying out at least 35 execution-style murders in Manaus, Brazil, which has become violent center for drug traffickers in South America; officials say killings may have been in retaliation for fatal shooting of police officer.
lead_paragraph: After the fatal shooting of a police officer, security officials say there are suspicions that police officers in Manaus organized a death squad this weekend that left at least 35 dead.

headline.main: Suspicion Falls on the Police After Dozens of Execution-Style Killings in Brazil
headline.print_headline: Suspicion Falls on the Police After Dozens of Execution-Style Killings in Brazil

snippet: After the fatal shooting of a police officer, security officials say there are suspicions that police officers in Manaus organized a death squad this weekend that left at least 35 dead.
